item.title: parenth-i18n_2.diff attached to Ticket #3511
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description: Better formatting of the code IMO (spaces added)

item.title: Ticket #3511 (exclude parentheses from translatable strings) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond

item.title: Ticket #3474 (misc i18n improvements) updated
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description:
There should be no problem with the runtime concatenation of ERROR: and the error message. First - it is clear what ERROR: stands for and all the error messages cannot be mistaken with non-error ones. Also there should be no troubles with concatenation, but we'd better ask the translator themselves.

According to ​this document IE and FF should handle the parentheses in rtl direction corectly.

I filed two patches for these issues.

item.title: Ticket #3512 (reuse ERROR: prefix in internationalized strings) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description: Move ERROR: out of translatable string in order to be translated only once and concatenate it with different error messages.

item.title: Ticket #3511 (exclude parentheses from translatable strings) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description: Move out parentheses if they just embrace a translatable string. It is very easy for translators to forget them out of the translation.

item.title: Ticket #3508 (__ vs __ngettext typo) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
fixed:

(In [4669]) ngettext() correction by nbachiyski. fixes #3508

item.title: Changeset [4669]: __ngettext() correction by nbachiyski. fixes #3508
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: ngettext() correction by nbachiyski. fixes #3508

item.title: Ticket #3510 (RTE should not change links like http://www.example.com/#foo to #foo) updated
item.dc:creator: KevinJB
item.description: Looks like this is a problem with TinyMCE, as it works just fine with the WYSIWYG editor turned off :)

item.title: Ticket #3510 (RTE should not change links like http://www.example.com/#foo to #foo) created
item.dc:creator: KevinJB
item.description:
Wordpress converts Link URLS like ​http://www.example.com/#foo to just #foo, but if you do something like ​http://www.example.com/index.html#foo it leaves it alone.

Not sure whether this is a feature (?) or a bug, asked in #wordpress on irc.freenode.net and no one there knew what it was

item.title: Ticket #3505 (TinyMCE 2.0.8, Missing some updates in advanced theme) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom

item.title: Ticket #3509 (Error trackback charset) created
item.dc:creator: maxsite
item.description:
The problem exists In WordPress 2 with coding (charset) trackbak.

Reception XML-request from trackbak is executed by means of file wp-trackback.php. In he is indicated: 

$charset = $_POST['charset'];

But, when sending trackbak, importance charset is not indicated.

The Error is situated in file functions.php (function trackback): 

$query_string = "title=$title&url=$url&blog_name=$blog_name&excerpt=$excerpt";

It is Correct: 

$query_string = "title=$title&url=$url&blog_name=$blog_name&excerpt=$excerpt&charset=" . get_settings('blog_charset');

The Error much aging, request to developer to correct.

ps Excuse me me for english - use google-translator.

item.title: Ticket #3508 (__ vs __ngettext typo) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description: Plural internationalization attempted with __ instead of with __ngettext.

item.title: Ticket #3507 (Plugin Listing Counts Symlinks as another plugin) updated
item.dc:creator: technosailor
item.description:
Yeah that's a different argument. Not invalid, but not the point here either. The point is that if you DO have a symlink in the plugins folder to another file/directory in the plugins folder, then the plugins page will report TWO instances of the plugin, instead of one.

I see where this is technically accurate but I think pretty confusing at the same time.

In my case, I need to have plugins in directories because SVN's incapability of supporting svn:external properties on files, and only supporting them on directories. So I've been playing with the idea of moving all files into directories, but this (I think) causes plugins then to become deactivated. (Now I'm not sure on this and need to go check!).

item.title: Ticket #3507 (Plugin Listing Counts Symlinks as another plugin) updated
item.dc:creator: masquerade
item.description:
I disagree. I personally use symlinks to keep plugins for multiple installs all updated by simply updating the file that the symlinks point to, and I believe for administrators of many similarly fashioned sites on a single server this should be essential.

-1 for this.

item.title: Ticket #3507 (Plugin Listing Counts Symlinks as another plugin) created
item.dc:creator: technosailor
item.description:
Symlinks are symlinks and shouldn't be counted as an additional file. However, the way the WP code reads at the moment, the only thing that is checked in determining if a plugin should be listed is if it is actually a file (checks true as symlinks point to files) and if it is a directory, looks for the file one directory down.

Proper behavior is to determine if the file is a file and that it is not a symbolic link.

Patch attached for the 2.0 branch. Imagine it should go in 2.1 as well. 

drwxr-xr-x   2 theafter theafter  4096 Dec 29 23:44 wp-mobile
lrwxrwxrwx   1 theafter theafter    76 Dec 29 23:44 wp-mobile.plugin.php -> /home/theafter/public_html/wp-content/plugins/wp-mobile/wp-mobile.plugin.php
